titleStmt.title: Letter from Annie A. Gray to Eartha M. M. White. July 11, 1920
titleStmt.author: Annie A. Gray

publicationStmt.p: This document was produced as part of the project "Northeast Florida Editing Workshop" at the University of North Florida.

msIdentifier.repository: University of North Florida, Thomas G. Carpenter Library Special Collections and Archives

msContents.summary: A letter from Annie A. Gray to Eartha M.M. White discussing her friend's job search, pastor's vacation, acquaintance's marriage, and Eartha M.M. White's ill mother.

objectDesc.p: The letter consists of three handwritten pages on plain bifold card in fair condition with slight darkening and few stains

editorialDecl.p: This file was transcribed and encoded according to the editorial criteria of the project "Northeast Florida Editing Workshop" (nfew.org) at the University of North Florida. Using the various options encoded within <choice> elements, this file enables the viewing of a diplomatic transcription and a regularized reading text.

body.p:
Just a word to cheer you -
received card and glad to
note that Mama WhiteLikely reference to Clara White, Eartha White's mother is
no worse at least, though
I was in hopes she was
better.

Brother Ross drops in on
me (and I mean drops in)
every now and then so on last
Thursday I carried him
to prayer meeting.
body.note: The text on the left page is transcribed as the third and final page of this letter as it appears to be contiguous to the end of the second page.
body.p:
He said he could not hear
Dr. GrimkePossible reference to Francis J. Grimké, a Presbyterian minister who served in Washington D.C. and Jacksonville, Florida. See "The Earnest Protest of Francis Grimké". Prebysterian Historical Society The National Archives of PC(USA), https://www.history.pcusa.org/blog/2016/07/earnest-protest-francis-grimk%C3%A9. Accessed 18 July, 2020. very good,. 'ofOf course,
Grimke does not try to make
deaf people hear.

Mr. Grimke leaves next week for
his vacation which ends the
2',,second Sunday in Sept.September. quiteQuite long
for a pastor, don't you think?
Ross hopes to get a church or
a Gov't.government position, but I think
he had better find something
else to do as he is rather
old for either job and now
they are putting men of his
'age out of the 'offices on a
pension-. hardlyHardly think he can
make good there-. iIs he going
all his life depending on a
little invitation here and there
to preach? dDid his wife send
him from home? It looks so de-
pendent to me. He told me that
his grand-daughter married Dr.
Campbell. howHow about it? Wish them
success. Well, kiss Mama White

p.note: The text of the letter continues in a non-contiguous block on the left inner page of the card at a ninety-degree angle to the first page of the letter on the right.

body.p:
for me and tell her I say to
get well so she can cook some
more cabbage and soup for me-,
that we can sit up half the night
and talk.

Old Pal, I do hope by now she
is feeling much better-. weWe are
still praying for you on this end.
